questions.question: Who wrote the poem Leisure?
questions.answer: William Henry Davies

questions.question: What does the poet say we have no time to do?
questions.answer: Stand and stare

questions.question: Which animals are mentioned in the poem?
questions.answer: Sheep and cows

questions.question: Who hides nuts in the grass?
questions.answer: Squirrels

questions.question: What shines like stars in the streams?
questions.answer: Reflections

questions.question: What does Beauty do in the poem?
questions.answer: Smiles

questions.question: What kind of life is called poor?
questions.answer: Life without leisure

questions.question: Which literary device opens the poem?
questions.answer: Rhetorical question

questions.question: What sense is mainly appealed to?
questions.answer: Sight

questions.question: What is the central idea of the poem?
questions.answer: Leisure and joy of nature

questions.answer: Life without leisure

questions.question: Which literary device opens the poem?
questions.answer: Rhetorical question

questions.question: What sense is mainly appealed to?
questions.answer: Sight

questions.question: What is the central idea of the poem?
questions.answer: Leisure and joy of nature

questions.question: Why does the poet call our life poor?
questions.answer: Because we are too busy to enjoy the beauty of nature.

questions.question: What does stand and stare mean?
questions.answer: It means to pause and observe nature calmly.

questions.question: What does care refer to in the poem?
questions.answer: Care refers to worries and stress of daily life.

questions.question: Why does the poet mention animals?
questions.answer: They show how naturally leisure is enjoyed.

questions.question: What picture of sheep is given?
questions.answer: Sheep are shown standing beneath the trees.

questions.question: How do squirrels spend their time?
questions.answer: They hide nuts in the grass happily.

questions.question: What comparison is made with streams?
questions.answer: Streams look like the sky full of stars.

questions.question: Why does Beauty smile?
questions.answer: Because she is reflected in nature.

questions.question: What modern problem does the poem highlight?
questions.answer: People are too busy to enjoy simple pleasures.

questions.question: What message does the poem convey?
questions.answer: Life should include leisure and appreciation of nature.
